Text: Our infrastructure bill is truly bipartisan, and because of that, Utah was given a seat at the table. I'm proud of this product because it is good for Utahns and good for communities across the country. https://t.co/zvDlb7yXY7

This bill would also help Utah mitigate drought conditions, prepare for and respond to wildfires, continue expanding broadband to rural communities, and fulfill critical water needs—which includes funds to bring running water to a substantial part of Utah’s Navajo Nation.

As one of the fastest growing states in the country, Utah is in serious need of additional infrastructure. This bipartisan infrastructure bill would provide Utah the funding to construct new, and rebuild and maintain its existing, roads and highways.

For decades, elected officials have talked about addressing our nation’s aging infrastructure. Our bipartisan bill turns that talk into reality. It's a true compromise, providing a once-in-a-generation investment in our country’s physical infrastructure without raising taxes.

The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act just passed the Senate–a win for Utah and communities across the country! I'm proud that I could help negotiate this historic, bipartisan bill which will provide a much-needed upgrade of our country's physical infrastructure. https://t.co/7YXZwmFhZy

Talk of the infrastructure bill allowing the government to track your driving through a VMT is fearmongering and misinformation. It creates a VOLUNTARY study to determine how electric cars can support the Highway Trust Fund so the burden isn't solely on those who pay a gas tax. https://t.co/vOKM8Vdrk3

Our bipartisan infrastructure bill is responsibly paid for. Not all of these “score” according to CBO, but they are real dollars: 
→ $173 billion in unused COVID funds
→ $53 billion from unused UI
→ $53 billion in economic growth resulting from a return on investment https://t.co/kuEOdg6FFk

Those saying our bill isn't about physical infrastructure aren't telling the truth. Out of $550B in new spending:
- $110B roads & bridges
- $66B rail
- $65B broadband
- $65B power/grid
- $54B water
- $46B resiliency
- $39B public transit

The full breakdown is publicly available. https://t.co/erdvWJjW01

The core of our infrastructure bill went through regular order, passing out of four Senate committees with bipartisan support. This means that nearly 2,000 of the 2,700 pages of this bill have been public for months. It hardly came out of nowhere. https://t.co/FSEpqU5FwQ

The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act is $550 billion in NEW spending, not $1.2 trillion as some have said. Our bill costs 1/3 of what President Trump proposed. It includes fiscally responsible pay-fors, including unused COVID-19 relief funds, and doesn't raise taxes. https://t.co/KWdfwDNNYx

Our infrastructure bill is a culmination of bipartisan collaboration and regular order. Nearly 2,000 of the 2,700 pages had already passed out of committees with bipartisan support—61 senators on 4 committees put together the bills, many of which have been public for months. https://t.co/3Gpla3ceUN
Watch my full remarks on the Senate floor here → https://t.co/24ljdbrdgo

This bipartisan infrastructure bill will provide an historic investment in our country's physical infrastructure. It's not a gateway to anything except better roads and bridges, better water systems, better broadband in rural communities, and better economic vitality. https://t.co/bJ0SeNrQ6I

Live soon→ I’ll be speaking about our bipartisan infrastructure bill on the Senate floor. This is an historic piece of legislation that will address decades of neglect of our nation’s physical infrastructure. https://t.co/mlS6RtPeXb

Eddy Alvarez, former @slccbaseball athlete, started in Tokyo as a flag bearer for @TeamUSA. He now goes home with a silver medal—adding to the silver he earned in speed skating at the 2014 Winter Olympics. Congratulations on such an amazing feat, @eddyalvarez90! https://t.co/32Bzm7OSRJ

Damian Lillard has shown incredible resiliency and resolve in Tokyo, ultimately helping secure gold for @TeamUSA. Congratulations, @Dame_Lillard! The legacy of excellence in men’s basketball at the @Olympics continues. https://t.co/DZympycMMs

As expected, CBO confirms half the bill is paid for with new revenue that “scores.” The other half is paid for with savings and other revenue (unused UI, unused COVID $) that don’t score under their rules, but they are real dollars.

Congratulations to Murray native and @TeamUSA athlete Nathaniel Coleman on winning the first-ever silver medal in climbing! History has been made. You’ve made us proud, Nathaniel! https://t.co/ACq47qiCrr

These brave Utah firefighters, once again, are answering the call to serve. Will be keeping them in our prayers as they deploy for two weeks in Montana to help fight wildfires. https://t.co/lu9UE5GgGi

Our bipartisan infrastructure bill is good for Utah, and provides a major upgrade to infrastructure across the nation. A bipartisan bill gave Utah a seat at the negotiating table. This bill may not be perfect, but it’s a big step forward for our state and the country. https://t.co/qGc1i5oBMT

A Republican-only infrastructure bill was not an option. With Democrats in the majority, they could have done an infrastructure bill entirely on their own. Our bipartisan bill represents a much better option–Republicans & Democrats working together as the American people expect. https://t.co/cCZ6gTSYZE

Both sides of the aisle agree that we need to upgrade our infrastructure. Roads and bridges are in need of repair, communities lack fast and reliable internet, and much of our transit systems are out of date. Our bipartisan bill would put American infrastructure back on track. https://t.co/WukF0tSh9o

I’ve been talking with folks across Utah while helping negotiate our bipartisan infrastructure bill.
 
Here's what they had to say→ https://t.co/k6fOIVfSNG

Hope is not a strategy—especially when it comes to our national security. Policies the Administration is advancing—like troop withdrawals and drawdowns from the Middle East—have extraordinary potential to be misinterpreted and should be reconsidered. https://t.co/E7j183wNI7

Our interests in the world go beyond simply protecting the homeland. It's vital to U.S. national security that we help keep events throughout the world from escalating until they ultimately do represent a threat to our security. https://t.co/UUqjcSAOPb

Accidents caused by flash floods and heavy rainstorms can be prevented by taking precautionary measures. As floods continue to run through communities across Utah, it’s important we each do our part to avoid anything unsafe, like driving through flood waters. https://t.co/8B4eUTHhmr

Attempting to force Krystsina Tsimanouskaya to leave the Olympic Games is the latest move by the Lukashenko regime to silence those who dare to criticize. I stand with this brave Olympian—this violation of basic human rights must not be tolerated. https://t.co/1BNS987SQo

A large portion of Utah is currently under flash flood watch or warning. @NWSSaltLakeCity provides resources and updates on flooding and other extreme weather events. I encourage Utahns to refer to these resources to ensure their safety and well-being. https://t.co/cid8FfvatT

Congratulations to Herriman native Rhyan White for helping @TeamUSA bring home a silver medal in the women’s 4x100-meter medley relay. She’s the first U.S. Olympic swimmer from our state to bring home a medal. Utah is immensely proud! https://t.co/l0HtL20XNt

Multiple flash floods are tearing across Utah, affecting communities from Bountiful to Cedar City. As we continue to monitor the situation, I urge Utahns to stay safe and reach out to others who may be in need. https://t.co/l9VPQga6Nc

Utah wouldn't have had a seat at the table if Democrats acted alone on infrastructure. Our bipartisan bill limits spending on bad policy that only benefits the coastal cities, and brings home measures to improve wildfire prevention and drought mitigation. https://t.co/e6f6IMlY6v

Our bipartisan bill focuses on physical infrastructure without raising taxes or adding to the debt. It demonstrates that the Senate can work in a bipartisan way, as the American people expect us to do. And that is a victory over those who seek to abolish the filibuster. https://t.co/d7JZxKAloI
Congratulations to former @UtahGymnastics athlete @mykaylaskinner! Your incredible story proves that determination and grit pays off in the end. You make us proud. #TeamUSA https://t.co/fIozL5lgUg

Col. Gail S. Halvorsen was a beacon of hope for many in the aftermath of the World War II–a hero who exemplifies the best of humanity and embodies Utah’s kindness and spirit of service. It is only fitting that we rename the Provo Vet Center in his honor. https://t.co/PAmWpV4zo3

The @CapitolPolice work tirelessly to protect our democracy. Today, the Senate ensured they have the funding necessary to maintain operations and secure the Capitol. The security bill also reimburses @UTNationalGuard for their support efforts this year. https://t.co/0LJJlIHoYd

It also includes funding to provide water to the 40% of Utah Navajos who don’t have running water and expand broadband into rural Utah. This legislation is a historic investment that delivers for Utah—without raising taxes and adding to the national debt. https://t.co/KtanHw2A6q

Our bipartisan infrastructure bill has cleared its next hurdle in the Senate. Proud to have helped negotiate this bill which includes funding that will help Utah rebuild its roads, mitigate drought conditions, fulfill critical water needs, and prepare for & respond to wildfires.

This is not a "national security" law–it's an assault on liberty by the CCP. It’s a damning indictment of the law that simply demanding promised freedoms is considered secession. This verdict sets a frightening precedent for freedom-loving people in Hong Kong. https://t.co/UEh364ycnb

E-cigarettes should be subject to the same user fees as traditional forms of tobacco. By authorizing @US_FDA to collect user fees on e-cigarettes, our bill will help tackle the vaping crisis and protect the lives of children in Utah & across the country. https://t.co/ocOBv880Hn

The Administration isn't taking the enforcement of immigration laws seriously. Calls to eliminate or defund @ICEgov are purely political and if answered, would jeopardize our national security. https://t.co/IzlhaLZ1NF

It’s absurd to assume that we can address the crisis at our southern border by magically eliminating corruption and violence throughout Latin America. @DHSgov needs to take the border crisis seriously. https://t.co/9Q4nUhH1Xv

What’s happening at our southern border is a crisis—yet there’s been no acknowledgement from the Administration. The scenes from our southern border are both alarming and threatening to our national security and economic vitality. https://t.co/LRGu2TxILy

The nation will remember Mike Enzi as a man of integrity and character. We would all do well to follow his example of treating others with respect and dignity. Ann and I share our profound condolences and sincere prayers for his family and loved ones.
Deeply saddened by this news. Praying for my friend’s recovery and the well-being of his loved ones during this difficult time. https://t.co/IHN17ZsxCb

Heartbroken over the tragic deaths and injuries following a 22-vehicle pileup near Fillmore on Sunday. Ann and I are praying for the victims and their loved ones as we grieve this terrible loss. https://t.co/ThWOdaqGQV

Utah is the second largest producer of tart cherries in the nation. Last week, I visited with Payson Fruit Growers, a co-op of family farms, to learn more about the challenges they’re facing—namely labor shortages, current trade practices, and the historic drought. https://t.co/ll0IxMOhJS
To all of the @Olympics athletes competing for @TeamUSA, especially my fellow Utahns, best of luck in Tokyo. Stay safe and healthy—we are cheering you on! #TokyoOlympics 🇺🇸 https://t.co/J0SF4xvSr1

As Utahns commemorate the anniversary of the arrival of the pioneers to the Salt Lake Valley, I hope we remember the great sacrifice and determination of the brave souls who helped build up our extraordinary state. Happy #PioneerDay! https://t.co/aEKG4adt6H

Tonight, Americans will be able to watch the @Olympics opening ceremonies during prime time. Great to see @eddyalvarez90, a former @BruinAthletics baseball star, bearing the United States flag. Go @TeamUSA! https://t.co/3H3FNguInG
Capping off the day at the Days of ‘47 Cowboy Games & Rodeo on the eve of #PioneerDay. It’s quite fun to be the guest of @AnnRomney! https://t.co/SKwPkDZO4H

Thanks to Utah’s pro-business climate, global companies like Stadler are coming here to grow their business. Toured their facility in Salt Lake to see their production—and even drove a train! We must ensure our policies continue to support businesses that employ Utahns. https://t.co/1GDqJqOnHo

On #PioneerDay, Utahns come together to celebrate and honor the legacy of our state’s pioneers. Kicked off this year’s celebrations with the Days of ‘47 Sunrise Service at Assembly Hall. https://t.co/pvZzaRp6RS

Our finest athletes have traveled to Tokyo to represent the United States at the @Olympics. The dedication of the athletes and coaches of the U.S. Olympic and Paralympic Teams is inspiring. We stand with @TeamUSA and will be cheering them on as they bring many medals back home 🇺🇸 https://t.co/vscMO5eMV3

When it's my turn to host lunch, hot dogs are on the menu!
 
Enjoyed introducing my colleagues to some Utah favorites today, including @JDawgsUtah, @PioneerChips, and ice cream & chocolate milk from @BYU Creamery. Great having JDawgs founder Jayson Edwards with us as well! https://t.co/6MUECSbtAX

Chinese-made renewable energy components—products such as electric batteries for vehicles and cells for solar panels—are made with Uyghur forced labor. We must continue to pursue green technologies, but these goals can't come at the expense of our values. https://t.co/UO2WcXafqJ

Investing in innovation and deploying existing carbon-reducing technologies is the most effective way to address climate change. The U.S. must play a leadership role in the development and adaptation of these technologies to protect our planet for future generations. https://t.co/802IjtfA1D

The numbers tell the story–#COVID19 is spreading quickly in Utah. 

I encourage all eligible Utahns to get vaccinated. 

These vaccines are safe, free, and readily available across the state. 

For more information: https://t.co/YNaANxkooW https://t.co/yluooR4BjD
Countries should think twice before getting in bed with the Putin regime. Turkey should reassess its relationship with Russia and align with its @NATO allies. https://t.co/wgJsZLW72W

The Delta variant is responsible for over 80% of new #COVID19 cases in the U.S. It's imperative that we quickly leverage existing, reliable epidemiological data on the effectiveness of vaccine boosters to determine if and when additional doses are needed. https://t.co/a1XhoZEJZw

Getting vaccinated is the best way to keep ourselves and our communities safe, and we must all do our part to address vaccine hesitancy. For more data and information, including how you can get a #COVID19 vaccine, check out @CDCgov, @HHSgov, @UtahCoronavirus & @UtahDepOfHealth. https://t.co/bqzz1AKR5l

This isn't just about stolen property—cyberattacks sponsored by the Chinese Communist Party pose a massive threat to our national security and that of our allies. @USNATO is right to accuse China of these attacks. The world must wake up to the threat China poses to global order. https://t.co/C262dDZChF

Utahns know all too well that the wildfires burning across the west are overwhelming many communities. Praying for the safety of these 57 courageous Utahns as they lend a helping hand to a nearby state in need. https://t.co/Z31MDUYfis

To be safe, Utahns should start their passport application with @TravelGov 6 months in advance of travel. There has been an increase in processing times due to increased demand and mail delays. For more information, including how to upgrade to expedited processing: https://t.co/7BiPrMgJfN

This harassment and suppression by Belarus officials is a hostile violation of fundamental human rights and must not continue. There's nothing authoritarian governments fear more than a free press like @RFERL. We stand with them in their mission to shine light on these abuses. https://t.co/Nt5cw7nrq6

Utahns who have not applied for a passport and are traveling in less than 12 weeks will likely need to request a walk-in appointment at a nearby passport office. However, this is done within 72 hours of travel—that’s why it’s important to start the application process early. https://t.co/7ZdVPYdq7o

Goods made by the Uyghur people in forced labor camps, sponsored by the Chinese Communist Party, have no place in the American market. Pleased that our legislation to ensure that items made with Uyghur forced labor don't wind up on our shelves unanimously passed the Senate. https://t.co/bDGS47kbUj

The #COVID19 vaccines are safe, effective, and free. We must all do our part to increase the confidence folks have in these vaccines and I urge all eligible Utahns to receive them without delay. https://t.co/nC8uM0RLDx

Increased demands for travel and mail delays are causing longer processing times for passports. Our team has been working with @TravelState, but it’s important to start the passport application process 6 months in advance of travel to be safe. For more information: https://t.co/cZjxduo13H

Terrifying. The lengths at which the Iranian government will go to silence critics—even American citizens—is appalling and unacceptable. This is yet another warning call that we must consistently take a hard line against their oppressive regime. https://t.co/HSfb7fyOGE

Outdated policies and poor federal forest management have led to devastating wildfires in Utah. My bill to establish a commission to study and recommend fire prevention, mitigation, and management policies was just unanimously voted out of committee. https://t.co/tsL8G29vKi

A thoughtful and accomplished public servant who will represent the U.S. and our interests well in a complex region of the world. I agree that foreign policy can be an area of bipartisanship and I look forward to meeting with my friend during his confirmation process. https://t.co/28P0EoMHI6

Our country’s infrastructure is in serious need of updates. The bipartisan infrastructure plan focuses on physical infrastructure without tax increases or adding to the deficit. It’s time we go beyond the rhetoric to get things done for our communities. https://t.co/ZQRu5TwnBf
This is the right decision. The U.S. should follow suit. https://t.co/l289OoMG1E
Though miles and sea separate us from the courageous Cubans demonstrating for freedom, we stand beside them with admiration and hope.

As one of the country’s fastest growing states, Utah is in need of additional infrastructure. Our bipartisan plan would provide Utah with funding to accommodate this rapid growth—including investment in roads, highways, and public transportation systems. https://t.co/ZQRu5TwnBf

The needs of Utahns have been forefront as I’ve helped negotiate our bipartisan infrastructure plan. Our plan would provide Utah with funding to expand our physical infrastructure and help fight wildfires without tax increases or adding to the deficit. https://t.co/ZQRu5TwnBf

As we celebrate our nation’s independence, let us continue the work of building a more perfect union. May we not take for granted the blessings that come with freedom and give thanks to the brave men and women who work to protect those freedoms every day. Happy #IndependenceDay https://t.co/Ai7bSU7Xlw

An authoritarian China is perhaps the greatest threat to freedom around the world. We’re seeing the effects that communism has on a society—suppressing independent thought and dissent, paired with egregious human rights violations. We must partner with allies to promote freedom.

100 years of the Chinese Communist Party is nothing to celebrate. The CCP continues to:
 
- commit genocide of 1 million Uyghurs
- imprison or execute dissidents
- censor print, broadcast, and social media
- renege on promised freedoms in Hong Kong
- spy on its citizens

China’s so-called “national security” law has been weaponized to severely undermine the rights and freedoms of the people of Hong Kong. The Administration must make clear that US support for Hong Kongers in their struggle for autonomy remains unequivocal. https://t.co/DIDBVujhaT

Donald Rumsfeld was a true public servant. During his two terms as Secretary of Defense, nearly 30 years apart, his strong leadership helped guide our country through some of our most challenging times. My thoughts are with his wife, Joyce, their children, and his loved ones.

It’s been 1 year since the Chinese Communist Party enacted its “national security” law on Hong Kong—using mass arrests and unjust imprisonments to crush political dissent. I continue to stand with the people of Hong Kong in their quest for the autonomy they were promised.

Republicans will not sign up for a multi-trillion dollar spending spree, or raising taxes on job creators, for “human infrastructure” that will raise the deficit to levels that will harm future generations. That’s why our bipartisan deal focuses solely on physical infrastructure. https://t.co/35POIQ9eHE

Our bipartisan infrastructure deal is an historic investment in our nation’s physical infrastructure. It’s truly bipartisan, incorporating legislation crafted and passed out of the Senate committees of jurisdiction. This deal has bipartisan support. https://t.co/ypWp0YLJfd

The American people don’t want to see massive tax increases—they want us to address our aging physical infrastructure. Senate Republicans & Democrats, and the White House, support our bipartisan infrastructure deal. Democratic leadership must let it come to the floor for a vote. https://t.co/RK0Y0zlJrL

Our bipartisan infrastructure deal focuses on true infrastructure—roads, bridges, rail, broadband, water and electric infrastructure—without raising taxes. And I take the President at his word that he’ll sign this bill when it gets to his desk. https://t.co/2oB2yJ9iiY

The Chinese Communist Party has now successfully eliminated one of Hong Kong’s top pro-democracy newspapers in their endless pursuit of silencing dissent. There’s nothing more terrifying to an authoritarian regime than independent thought and a free press. https://t.co/e5vRyakw0Z

Our nation's infrastructure is in need of repair. We've reached a deal on an infrastructure package that focuses on physical infrastructure—roads, bridges, airports—without raising taxes or adding to the deficit. We'll keep working with colleagues to get this signed into law. https://t.co/ptrGLsb1X5

This is one reason why having a public hearing on the authorizations for use of military force in Iraq is so important. We need to hear from @StateDept & @DeptOfDefense officials before making seemingly rushed decisions that could impact national security. https://t.co/nqNmVa8DOW

We need to fully evaluate the conditions on the ground and consider the policy and potential legal consequences of our reduced presence in the region before rushing to withdraw troops and capabilities, and considering the repeal of authorizations for use of military force.

Six months. The Afghan government is estimated to collapse six months after a withdrawal of U.S. troops. Politics should never come before our national security interests. The President must reconsider his plan to withdraw all American troops from Afghanistan by September. https://t.co/AWVSUdggwA

Today’s show vote is about Democrats building their case to blow up the filibuster & destroy this institution if they don’t get their way—which is exactly why we must preserve the filibuster. Changes to our democracy must be made by broad consensus, not small partisan majorities.

At a time when we must restore trust in the American electoral system and ensure that elections continue to be fair and secure, S.1 does the exact opposite. It’s a divisive, federal takeover of elections which would use public dollars to fund political campaigns.

In Utah, nearly 400 wildfires have already burned more than 40,000 acres of land—surpassing the 5-year average for this time of year. We can't continue to adhere to outdated fire policies. Our bill will help craft a comprehensive strategy for preventing and fighting wildfires. https://t.co/aPsASSLW5q

The American West is facing a historic level of wildfires. My bill with @SenMarkKelly & @RepJohnCurtis would bring together officials from all levels of gov. & experts to improve strategies to prevent future wildfires from becoming catastrophic disasters. https://t.co/tsL8G2r6BQ

Legislation to repeal authorizations for use of military force against Iraq requires us to fully evaluate the legal and national security implications before voting. The Senate must hold a public hearing & a classified briefing before taking up this issue. https://t.co/ryuqvFRZlo

The Administration is promoting #ChildTaxCreditAwarenessDay, but POTUS’s plan is just temporary and adds to the debt. My plan makes a permanent commitment to American families and is fully paid for. We have the opportunity for a lasting, historic achievement if we work together. https://t.co/xWhmK24DzM

So far this year, in Utah, nearly 400 fires have burned more than 40,000 acres of land. My bill would create a commission of officials from all levels of government and outside experts to recommend policies that will prevent future wildfires from becoming catastrophic disasters. https://t.co/OpTJRsT9YM

Richard is a Vietnam War veteran and West Valley City resident who, unfortunately, lost many of his service medals 20 years ago. Our office helped him get replacement medals and this morning, I was able to present them to him. https://t.co/D3FfxmGSHM

Federal efforts to seriously evaluate our national fire policies have lacked critical input from state, local & nongovernmental stakeholders who are expert in managing fires, lands & disasters. In @DraperCity, I unveiled our Wildland Fire Mitigation & Management Commission Act. https://t.co/CiarKmN7Eo
